thread.title: Tirdad Derakhshani's TV picks: 'Walking Dead,' 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend,' 'Manhattan,' 'The Brain,' Amy Schumer
thread.title_full: Tirdad Derakhshani's TV picks: 'Walking Dead,' 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend,' 'Manhattan,' 'The Brain,' Amy Schumer

title: Tirdad Derakhshani's TV picks: 'Walking Dead,' 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend,' 'Manhattan,' 'The Brain,' Amy Schumer
text:
The Walking Dead. Zombie fever continues as this gory classic enters its sixth season with a 90-minute episode, featuring new cast members Merritt Wever ( Nurse Jackie ) and Ethan Embry and the return of Season One favorite Lennie James. 9 p.m. Sunday on AMC.
Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. A surreal musical dramedy co-created by Rachel Bloom ( Robot Chicken ) and writer Aline Brosh McKenna ( The Devil Wears Prada ) stars Bloom as a Manhattan lawyer who moves to a remote California town to pursue peace, happiness, and goofiness. 8 p.m. Monday on CW.
Manhattan. Part espionage thriller, part war 'n' science epic,
part romantic melodrama, this acclaimed series about the men who built the first A-bomb - and the women who love them - returns for its second season. New stars include William Petersen, Neve Campbell, and Mamie Gummer. 9 p.m. Monday on WGN.
More coverage A rebooted 'Fargo' returns just as good as before The Brain with David Eagleman. Neuroscientist and author David Eagleman hosts this six-part science documentary that explores the ins and outs of the human brain. A companion book by Eagleman also is available. 10 p.m. Wednesday on
TV12 (WHYY-TV).
Amy Schumer: Live from the Apollo.
The acclaimed comic, writer, producer, and all-around cool chick tells it like it is in her first HBO stand-up special. 10 p.m. Saturday on HBO.
